radiographic_examinations.procedure_name: Upper gastrointestinal series with small-bowel follow-through
radiographic_examinations.findings: Several massively dilated loops of distal small bowel with intervening areas of stricture.

Extensive inflammatory changes in the right lower quadrant, medial to the cecum; abnormal enhancement of the cecal wall and ascending colon; enlargement of mesenteric lymph nodes; several massively dilated loops of distal small bowel with airâ€“fluid levels and intervening strictures.
Changes nearly identical to those seen on the previous scan, as well as a small amount of intraperitoneal fluid in the pelvis and diffuse hepatic fatty infiltration.
Reticulonodular interstitial infiltrate in the apex of the right lung.
Tree-in-bud appearance characteristic of endobronchial spread of tuberculosis; blunting of right lateral costophrenic sulcus, scarring at the right lung base, indicating prior tuberculous pleuritis.
